item.title: montager: a script to generate Hunt Showdown montages
item.description: I want to write some python python code that'll take a folder containing Hunt Showdown video highlights generated through Nvidia Highlights (most of which are exactly 25s long) and automatically generate a "montage" video containing all the highlights>>

item.title: Footnotes
item.description:
This is a test sup id="fnref:1" role="doc-noteref">a href="#fn:1" class="footnote" rel="footnote">1a>sup>
Now I can add footnotes to my essays to make myself seem 100x more intelligent (or obnoxious). div class="footnotes" role="doc-endnotes"> ol> li id="fn:1" role="doc-endnote"> How does this look?
How about this.
ul> li>Thisli> li>Thatli> li>Potatoli> ul> a href="#fnref:1" class="reversefootnote" role="doc-backlink">↩a> li> ol> div>

item.title: Embeds, embeds, embeds
item.description:
I wrote some code to help me embed audio files into my blog posts easily…
div class="d-flex justify-content-center readable"> div class="d-flex align-items-center justify-content-center"> figure> figcaption>figcaption> audio controls="" src="/bin/music/TheThird.wav"> Your browser does not support the code>audiocode> element. audio> figure> div> div>
em>Here's a song I produced about 5 years ago. It>>em>

item.title: 4 chill beats to work to
item.description:
ul> li>a href="https://nervoustestpilot.co.uk/">nervoustestpilota>li> li>a href="https://macross82-99.bandcamp.com/">Macross 82-99a>li> li>a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Panchiko">Panchikoa>li> li>a href="https://www.lukhash.com/">LukHasha>li> ul>
…
I feel like my productivity gets boosted substantially if I'm listening to the right kind of music music?
Or maybe a href="https://www.bbc.com/worklife/article/20200317-does-music-help-us-work-it-depends">listening to good music makes me happy (and more productive)?a>.
Or maybe>>

item.title: Writing #1
item.description:
My bars are low, almost completely drained. But here I am, back again for more. Doing exactly what I do everyday. Typing words on my computer.
I'm a programmer by day, a writer by night. I'm a much better programmer than I am a writer. If you've ever>>

item.title: ABCs #3
item.description:
img src="/img/chicken_pot_pie.jpg" alt="chicken pot pie" class="img-fluid rounded mx-auto d-block">
blockquote> Alcohol, being crushed, dull every freedom
Gobble hetero immaturity
Juggle KKK, layman money night
Obsession perverted, quest running stop
Toppling ultimatum vampiress
Win xenon, yodeling, zigzaggedness blockquote>
blockquote> Alps, butt cool, dying>> blockquote>

item.title: ABCs #2
item.description:
Ale brought chaos, down everywhere fortune
Gaze him into jab, kill love man-of-war
Neither of prison, quarter rocky stone
Tainted undulation vain waifs XoX
Yuppification. Zygophyllaceous.

item.title: ABCs #1
item.description:
All being cool, do everything flying
Get high, inhale juvenile karmic love
Make naan on pan? question rhetorical

Well, here you go.

item.title: Sleep
item.description: I forgot to set my alarm last night, so I woke up 2h after I was expecting to and that's thrown off my entire day. I can't fix this by going to sleep 2h later than usual because I want to get a good night's sleep and I want to wake up at my usual time>>

item.title: Cutting my own hair
item.description:
I've been cutting my own hair for the past few years.
Here's what I've learned:
ul> li>A decent hair trimmer costs as much as a single haircut. If you can learn how to cut your own hair with one then you can save a little time and money.li> li>If you're looking>>li> ul>

item.title: A (work)day in the life
item.description:
em>6:30am.em>
I wake up. It's still dark outside. I sit on the toilet bowl and piss. I get up and walk over to my closet. I pull out some socks, pajama pants or shorts depending on the weather and a polo shirt.
I get dressed.
I walk over to my living room>>

item.title: Writing... It's a Process
item.description: On and off, since early 2017, I've been writing about the video games I play. I've always loved video games and writing so it seemed like a good idea to write about video games for fun. I got into the habit of writing concise reviews for most of the>>

item.title: A Political Video Game: Suzerain
item.description: Suzerain is a text-based role-playing game where you play as President Anton Rayne leading the fictional country of Sordland in a political drama driven by conversations with your cabinet members and other significant people. The decisions you make>>

item.title: The PC master race is over: the Xbox Series X won
item.description: blockquote> I spent a lot of money purchasing an Xbox Series X. I'm encouraged to rationalize my purchases to make myself feel less bad about spending money on luxury instead hiding it away for a rainy day when I'm older and more broken than I am today. As always>> blockquote>

item.title: Social Deduction through Text Chat in Untrusted
item.description: I've been lucky during these uncertain times to have been able to keep in touch with my close friends and forge new relationships through the internet. I've been in lockdown for most of this past year and because I live alone, I've been doing a lot>>

item.title: Time to Die in Risk of Rain 2
item.description: Time always moves forward whether you like it or not. In the blink of an eye, the present becomes the past and the future becomes the present. Every moment spent standing still is a moment not spent moving forward. We've all been standing still for>>

item.title: Beware the God Killer in Yoku's Island Express
item.description: Time stood still as a new kind of old evil ravages the world as we know it, freezing us in time and space, while we clutch our crosses in fear. Sadly, God is dead and we killed him. In a time of unprecedented irrationality, ignorance and stupidity,>>

item.title: Piloting and Tinkering in Ring Runner
item.description: Nowadays, I lower my expectations as low as they can possibly go before playing a new video game. Maybe I've been disappointed one too many times or maybe I'm a pessimist. Either way, because I set the bar so low, when an amazing game falls into my>>

item.title: Good games I played in 2020
item.description: 2020 was definitely a year, but 2021 is just around the corner. I haven't had the opportunity to do much else other than play games this year which is a silver lining that I don't want to take for granted. I've never before had the time to play as many>>

item.title: Valve, Steam and You
item.description: If you're a PC gamer in 2020 then chances are you use Steam as one of your platforms of choice to purchase PC games. You might not know that Valve, the people behind Steam and many beloved game series such as Half Life, Portal, Left 4 Dead, Counter>>

item.title: Ready, Set, VR?

item.title: Moving Out, Growing In
item.description:
Moving out of my childhood home to live on my own was going to be tough. I realized this as I rolled out of the U-Haul truck with a piece of toast in one hand and my hopes and dreams in the other.
I moved out of my family's place a little more than>>

item.title: Chronic Pain and HUGE Trackballs
item.description: blockquote> WARNING: If you've got pain in your body, listen to it. If you're a big Gamer, please take breaks and play responsibly. Video games are wonderful but they aren't worth destroying your mind and body over playing them, or making them. You'll thank>> blockquote>

item.title: Baby's First 3D Models for Printing
item.description:
I've been thinking of buying a 3D printer…
It's something I've always been interested in but until recently I haven't had the space for it. The consumer 3D printing world has gotten a lot cheaper and simpler to get into in recent years.
In preparation>>

item.title: The Second Coming of Rust
item.description:
In these UNCERTAIN TIMES, I've found myself with a little more free time than usual because I haven't needed to commute to an office every day. I've tried to funnel that energy into creative and constructive hobbies. Keyword: em>triedem>.
In the past week>>

item.title: Hunt, Showdown, Repeat
item.description: You are a bounty hunter dredging through demon-infested Louisiana swamps in an alternate timeline of our 1895 but with some anachronisms thrown in. You need to find, then kill a demonic monster and, finally, leave the swamp as quickly as you can. Problem>>

item.title: A Gamer's Guide to: Online Multiplayer
item.description:
Welcome to my first "A Gamer's Guide to…". This series of articles will cover a wide range of topics of interest to gamers from the perspective of a video game programmer.
I know a little about what goes into making a video game. I gained a wide breadth>>

item.title: You can always reload, until you can't
item.description: Most games don't matter. The actions you play out within most games don't have any long term impact on you as a player. Some narrative games imply that the choices you make have an impact on the world but given that the world is imaginary, does it really>>

item.title: Interviews - The Good, the Bad and the Ugly
item.description: Looking for a job sucks. A couple of months ago, I was going through interview after interview like a wrecking ball blasting through concrete. No buildings were destroyed in the process but I may have burned some bridges along the way. We laughed, we>>

item.title: My Game of the Year List for 2019
item.description:
I love video games. I've loved them almost my entire life. I loved them enough to make making them my job. I'm not working in video game development anymore but I still enjoy playing games and pondering over them.
Here's a list of the video games I>>

item.description:
I recently dove head first into the world of Warhammer 40k. A dark and edgy tabletop game born in the 80s played with many miniature models of science fiction soldiers, aliens, etc.
If you've heard of space orks (generic fantasy orcs thrust forty thousand>>

item.title: I code review an 8 year old project
item.description: One of the first projects I worked on after learning how to program, around 8 years ago, is called a href="https://github.com/KeikakuB/writerator/tree/legacy">writeratora>. It is a Python command line interface (or CLI for short) for analyzing English language text and generating randomized poetry such as haikus>>

item.title: Building a website for 17$ or less
item.description:
The website you're reading this on was built by myself and it cost me a total of 17$ CDN (yearly). Without a custom domain it would have cost me nothing, zilch, nada.
My goal for this website was to create my own space on the internet to allow me to>>

item.description:

I'd be hard pressed to come up with a better brief description>>

item.title: The website, Mortal Kombat 11 and microtransactions
